title: Big Bug with Vault which i have already reported: Case #606962

activities.message:
Also going to post original email i sent to coinbase.

Hi coinbase,

today i have found a huge exploit that basically allows anyone to duplicate their bitcoins and basically gain free bitcoins from coinbase. I though i would do the right thing and report it and hopefully i can get a very nice bounty for this.


EXPLENATION:

Alright so the exploit is basically around btc vault when withdrawing, after the withdraw gets cleared (before completion) it gets credited to your wallet since i used my mobile after that i was able to spend my btc freely from my wallet since the withdrawn was never completed, it was just cleared. after i spent all the btc from my wallet i just cancelled my withdrawn and it got credited back to vault and my wallet balance turned into negative. then after that i would normally be able to create another wallet and withdraw or just close my account and get all the btc from the vault. which i have already spent meaning i would be duplicating the amount of coins i have, then i would just repeat by creating another account and doing everything on repeat. This can be fixed easily by crediting the bitcoins to the wallet only after completion of withdraw, not only clearance.



Hopefully i explained everything in detail and i did the right thing to report this and hopefully i can get a very good bounty from you guys. I have always respected coinbase’s work. I will also include some screenshots as attachments in this email.




Thanks,  

David Jones
activities.markdown_message:
Also going to post original email i sent to coinbase.

Hi coinbase,

today i have found a huge exploit that basically allows anyone to duplicate their bitcoins and basically gain free bitcoins from coinbase. I though i would do the right thing and report it and hopefully i can get a very nice bounty for this.

EXPLENATION:

Alright so the exploit is basically around btc vault when withdrawing, after the withdraw gets cleared (before completion) it gets credited to your wallet since i used my mobile after that i was able to spend my btc freely from my wallet since the withdrawn was never completed, it was just cleared. after i spent all the btc from my wallet i just cancelled my withdrawn and it got credited back to vault and my wallet balance turned into negative. then after that i would normally be able to create another wallet and withdraw or just close my account and get all the btc from the vault. which i have already spent meaning i would be duplicating the amount of coins i have, then i would just repeat by creating another account and doing everything on repeat. This can be fixed easily by crediting the bitcoins to the wallet only after completion of withdraw, not only clearance.

Hopefully i explained everything in detail and i did the right thing to report this and hopefully i can get a very good bounty from you guys. I have always respected coinbase’s work. I will also include some screenshots as attachments in this email.

Thanks,

David Jones

activities.message:
Thanks for reporting this David.

In future, if you find any security issues please submit them directly to Hackerone (rather than support@coinbase.com), as this is more secure and you can work directly with our engineering team while we fix them.

We appreciate you reporting this to us quickly!
activities.markdown_message:
Thanks for reporting this David.

In future, if you find any security issues please submit them directly to Hackerone (rather than support@coinbase.com), as this is more secure and you can work directly with our engineering team while we fix them.

We appreciate you reporting this to us quickly!

activities.message: I will do that, thanks for the bounty, but i kinda suspected to get 15k+ for this since it was a very severe exploit and i do think it was worth way more than 5k, but either way thanks i guess.
activities.markdown_message: I will do that, thanks for the bounty, but i kinda suspected to get 15k+ for this since it was a very severe exploit and i do think it was worth way more than 5k, but either way thanks i guess.

activities.message:
and how do i withdraw the money?

EDIT: Its all good i found a way.
activities.markdown_message:

activities.message: Thanks for the bounty once again, but as i dont want to sound cocky i really do feel like the bounty should have been at least 3 times larger, because of the caliber of the vulnerability.
activities.markdown_message: Thanks for the bounty once again, but as i dont want to sound cocky i really do feel like the bounty should have been at least 3 times larger, because of the caliber of the vulnerability.

activities.message:
Thanks for the feedback. We are actually about to publish an update to our bug bounty policy making it more clear how much we pay out for various types of bugs.

I want to clarify that this is already a large bounty and much higher than what we normally pay. It is on par or better than what very large global companies are paying for security issues - you can see other public bounties being paid to reporters here:

https://hackerone.com/hacktivity
activities.markdown_message:

activities.message:
Hey Adrian,

I have checked the bounties for other hacks and i guess i consider the 5k fair. I do still think coinbase should remove the -2btc negative balance that i have, which was caused by this bug.

activities.message:
Hi David,

In light of recent publicity around this submission we think it's in the best interest of the community to see how we're conducting our bug bounty program.  We're thus requesting full public disclosure on this thread.

Thanks,
Coinbase Security Team
